Issues.Title: Verify copyright headers in CI
Issues.Body:
This shows one approach to validating the .NET Foundation copyright header in all files added to the project. A code fix is provided to add the header if a file is missing one. See notes in the diff for additional commentary.

⚠️ I wanted the file header warnings (SA1633, SA1636) to show up as warnings when building inside the IDE, but I was not able to do that. Something in the current project configuration is forcing warnings to be treated as errors everywhere. I typically configure projects so code style issues are reported as warnings during iterative development, and only turn into errors for command line builds (optional) and CI builds (encouraged).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Verify copyright headers in CI" (#213)

Issues.Title: Clean up resx code
Issues.Body:
- Use newer C# features where possible
- Compare types directly
- Use char `String.Split` overload
- Replaced `str != null && str.Length > 0` pattern with `String.IsNullOrEmpty`
- Use language keywords insted of BCL types
- Removed unused parameter `isMetaData` in `ResXResourceReader.ParseAssemblyNode`
- Removed unused field `binaryFormatter ` in `ResXResourceWriter`
- Simplified/unnested `if` statements where possible
- Replaced `for` loops with `foreach` loops
- Fixed local variable naming in a few places
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Clean up resx code" (#212)

Issues.Title: Verb runas does not trigger UAC elevation in preview 1
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (3.0 Preview1)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
It is very common to call another executable using `Process` class and pass `"runas"` as verb to trigger UAC prompt, so that the executable to call is launched as elevated.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
No UAC prompt. The executable is launched but not elevated.

**Expected behavior:**
UAC prompt should show. The executable should be launched and elevated.

**Minimal repro:**
Will attach later.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Verb runas does not trigger UAC elevation in preview 1" (#204)

Issues.Title: Remove unused symbols and commented code from resx code
Issues.Body: SYSTEM_WEB, UNUSED, SOAP_FORMATTER, aren't set anywhere. SoapFormatter is obsolete since .NET 2.0, and there is no System.Web in .NET Core :)

Issues.Title: update issue-guide.md to include new PR labels
Issues.Body:
We found there was a need to include labels for requesting that a PR's history not be squashed at merge-time. We also found that we needed to better communicate when testing was required internally before a PR could be merged. 

These two labels were added to resolve these needs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "update issue-guide.md to include new PR labels" (#203)

Issues.Title: Incorrect ThreadExceptionDialog
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:
```
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview-009812\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.0.0-preview1-27031-02
  Commit:  16fc8e9125
```
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework? No

**Problem description:**

Thread Exception Dialog shows some issues:

- Resources are not used
- Buttons overlap
- Text is not formatted

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14916339/49663771-82702180-fa04-11e8-937a-573b423ea573.png)



**Expected behavior:**
Same as .NET Framework

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14916339/49663855-cf53f800-fa04-11e8-81af-d82fe9fb8b3b.png)


**Minimal repro:**
`dotnet new winforms` and edit the Form1.cs to throw an exception from button click

```cs
private void buttonExit_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
    throw new Exception("MyException");
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorrect ThreadExceptionDialog" (#202)

Issues.Title: Pressing UpButton/DownButton should jump to the matching item when setting a part of text , which similar to one of DomainUpDown collection
Issues.Body:
Background: recently, we updated the testcase project's targeting pack to .Net 4.7.3, found this regression issue from .Net 4.7.2

Repro Steps:

1.     Create a Winforms application with targeting latest .net 4.7.3 and add a DomainUpDown to form designer
2.      Add and setting to UseLegacyScrolling quirk value to ‘true’ from default value ‘false’ in app.config file
     <runtime>
          <AppContextSwitchOverrides value="Switch.System.Windows.Forms.DomainUpDown.UseLegacyScrolling=true"/>
     </runtime>
3.     Copy following code to from1.cs file behind the InitializeComponent()
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo1");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo2");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo3");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("Cowman");
     domainUpDown1.Items.Add("foo4");
     domainUpDown1.SelectedIndex = 0; //Set SelectedIndex to a valid value
4.     Run application
5.     Input a text “Cow” in DomainUpDown, then click UpButton/DownButton

Actual:
Pressing UpButton, it jumps to foo3 item; Pressing DownButton, it jumps to foo4 item.

Expected:
Pressing UpButton/DownButton, they all jump to matching item: Cowman in DomainUpDown item. It means UpButton/DownButton jumps to the item's index.

Related internal bug: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/590429
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Pressing UpButton/DownButton should jump to the matching item when setting a part of text , which similar to one of DomainUpDown collection" (#195)

Issues.Title: System.Drawing.Primitves is part of NETCoreApp and should not require a packagereference
Issues.Body:
System.Drawing.Primitives has been part of NETCoreApp since 2.0 https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/d6173e069a9bcedfdfd7f4f41e67d23f67157b61/src/System.Drawing.Primitives/dir.props#L7

You can delete https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/457ebceaabfd2982e431c2eecbb69e80f9482e61/eng/Versions.props#L16
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/457ebceaabfd2982e431c2eecbb69e80f9482e61/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System.Windows.Forms.csproj#L20
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.Drawing.Primitves is part of NETCoreApp and should not require a packagereference" (#194)

Issues.Title: win-x64 publish with Core3 Preview and VS2019 results in ""CheckEmbeddedRootDescriptor" task was not given a value for the required parameter "AssemblyPath""
Issues.Body:
I have been trying to publish a plain dotnet new winforms app by following the steps [here]([url](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/samples/linker-instructions.md)), but I end up with error: error MSB4044: The "CheckEmbeddedRootDescriptor" task was not given a value for the required parameter "AssemblyPath".

See attached image for the whole process. 

I am running VS2019 Preview and have the following SDKs installed: https://www.screencast.com/t/29MbjIeY04 

Any advice on how I can overcome this?
![linker_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1288402/49526561-be966b80-f8b8-11e8-9af1-ab64f18b0801.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "win-x64 publish with Core3 Preview and VS2019 results in ""CheckEmbeddedRootDescriptor" task was not given a value for the required parameter "AssemblyPath""" (#210)
